body_html: Yes, it's a known wrinkle, that would only be properly solved with a dedicated op or a GPU implementation of sparse_to_dense. In practice, there should be no good reason to want to enforce a hard placement of all the ops on GPU though. With soft placement, you may let the graph mostly run on GPU and back off to CPU only for this one op without a GPU equivalent.

body: Yes, it's a known wrinkle, that would only be properly solved with a dedicated op or a GPU implementation of `sparse_to_dense`. In practice, there should be no good reason to want to enforce a hard placement of all the ops on GPU though. With soft placement, you may let the graph mostly run on GPU and back off to CPU only for this one op without a GPU equivalent.
